SEARCH
Module org.myjtools.jexten.plugin
Package org.myjtools.jexten.plugin

Interface PluginValidator

Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface PluginValidator
Interface for custom plugin validators.

Implementations can perform custom validation logic on plugin manifests before they are installed. Validators are executed in the order they are added to the PluginManager.

Usage Example


 // Create a custom validator
 PluginValidator licenseValidator = manifest -> {
     if (manifest.licenseName() == null || manifest.licenseName().isBlank()) {
         return ValidationResult.invalid("Plugin must specify a license");
     }
     return ValidationResult.valid();
 };

 // Add to plugin manager
 pluginManager.addValidator(licenseValidator);

Built-in Validators

The framework provides several built-in validators through static factory methods:
  • requireLicense() - Ensures plugins have a license specified
  • requireUrl() - Ensures plugins have a URL specified
  • requireDescription() - Ensures plugins have a description
See Also:
  • ValidationResult
  • PluginManager.addValidator(PluginValidator)

  • Method Details

    • validate

      ValidationResult validate(PluginManifest manifest)
      Validates a plugin manifest.
      Parameters:
      manifest - the plugin manifest to validate
      Returns:
      the validation result indicating success or failure with error messages

    • and

      default PluginValidator and(PluginValidator other)
      Creates a composite validator that runs this validator followed by another.

      Both validators are always executed, and their results are merged.

      Parameters:
      other - the other validator to chain
      Returns:
      a new validator that combines both validations

    • requireLicense

      static PluginValidator requireLicense()
      Creates a validator that requires plugins to have a license specified.
      Returns:

      static PluginValidator requireMinimumVersion(String minVersion)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a validator that checks the minimum version requirement
